CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 5, 1966, pg. 1B, reads: "Because You're You, said members of the Mother's Club last week when they gathered at the home of Mrs. Virginia Gittens, and showered member Ethel Golden, with beautiful hankies. Because of her devotion to the club and extra work on its behalf, honors were due.  left to right: Mmes. Beatrice Washington, Frankie Conrad, Bea Jones, the Honoree, Peggy Moore, Ada Rickmond and Gertrude Jones. - Harris Photo."  Accompanying article by Toki Schalk Johnson reads: "Indian summer sent warming rays of golden sunlight on the city of McKeesport last week to make the top flight social events taking place, happy riches of delight.  The celebrated Semper Fidelis Club gave its fourth annual 'Woman of the Year' luncheon.  It was just a marvelous excuse for the feminine guests to arrive in glittering splendor to honor Miss Jeanne Dix, teacher in Pittsburgh School System.  Adding to an exciting afternoon, John Clay, young designer, showed some of his own creations, and then demonstrated how he designs with brush and paint. Another day, the home of Mrs. Virginia Gittens was a joyous spot when the Mothers Club surprised devoted member Mrs. Samuel Ethel Golden with a handkerchief shower.  It's moments like these that make life worth living and club work more enjoyable. - Toki Johnson."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Beatrice Washington, Frankie Conrad, Bea Jones, Ethel Golden, Peggy Moore, Virginia Gittens, Ada Rickmond, and Gertrude Jones, presenting wrapped handkerchiefs to Golden, in Gittens home for Mother's Club meeting, McKeesport
